definitions.definition: to become physically separated from something, or to make two things become physically separated:
examples: The door was disengaged from one of its hinges.

definitions.definition: to switch off the control of something:
If you disengage the clutch of a car, you stop the power produced by the engine being connected to the wheels.
to stop being involved in something, or to stop someone being involved in something:
examples: They recognized that the country would revive only if it thoroughly disengaged from the chaos of the old regime.
